intro: Cicerbita rechingeriana, commonly known as the Rechinger's cicerbita, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and is often found in mountainous areas. Its leaves are edible and have a peppery taste, similar to other members of its family. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
